info.name: Business Guy
info.description: Stock holding game powered by the original No Thanks auction. Bid to have a chance at stock and infrastructure investments, or cash out and take the pot.
info.helpText:
Have everyone take a seat and start the game via the the "Game Setup" button. 

All accounting is automated. For this to work, you should always use the "Deal & Dividend" button, rather than manually revealing the next card up for auction. Similarly, there are buttons available for bidding, cashing out, selling shares and for the lifeline of buying 3 bidding chips if you run out. The only things that need to be dragged manually are claiming a share and placing buildings on the infrastructure investment tracks. 

If you need to edit the scores for any reason, you can simply click on the VP counter.

At the end of the game, use the three final scoring buttons to add the end-game scoring opportunities and get the total VP for each player. (These will appear once the Market Crash card is drawn)
info.attribution: Implementation and Layout by Tobias Lunte (Tobl on bgg) and released to the Public Domain under CC0.

fields.text: Make sure at least 3 seats are occupied

_startingCardSets: First three entries left empty as minimum player count is 3
starting hand of the first player is the last entry in the array
e.g. for 5 players the hands are given in the order (2,3,4,5,1)

fields.text: Once per game, you may spend 3 VP to buy 3 bidding chips. Do you want to do so?
